title: Reflection and Self-Assessment
description: Demonstrate your understanding by creating and explaining a Python code example on a topic of your choice.

sections.title: Introduction to Reflection
sections.content:
Reflection is a powerful learning tool that helps solidify your understanding. In this lesson, you will choose a topic from the previous lessons, create a code example, and explain how it works.

You'll receive feedback from an AI assistant that will help you improve your understanding and expression of Python concepts.

sections.title: Python Concept Reflection
sections.content: Choose a topic from the previous lessons that you found interesting or challenging. Create a simple code example that demonstrates this concept, and write 3-4 sentences explaining how the code works.

prompts.topic: Choose a topic you've learned about
prompts.code: Create a simple example that demonstrates this topic
prompts.explanation: Explain how your example works (3-4 sentences)

rubric.not demonstrated: The explanation shows almost no effort and provides no insights or analysis.
rubric.developing: The explanation is brief or contains misconceptions about how the code works.
rubric.mostly there: The explanation correctly describes how the code works and demonstrates understanding of the core concept.
rubric.achieves: The explanation shows deep understanding of the concept, including nuances or connections to other concepts.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content:
Congratulations on completing the Python in the Browser course! You've learned fundamental Python concepts, practiced coding, and now demonstrated your understanding through reflection.

Remember that learning to code is a journey - continue practicing and building projects to strengthen your skills.
